question:
Which of the following pairs are correct?
(1) The Indian Councils Act, 1909 — Provincial Autonomy
(2) The Government of Act, 1919 — Introduction of India Dyarchy
(3) The Government Act, 1935 — Proposal for a of India Federation of India
(4) The Indian Act, 1947 — Provincial Independence Legislature
explanation:
With regard to the provinces, the act of 1935 was an improvement on the existing position. It introduced what is known as provincial autonomy.
On August 1935, the Government of India passed longest act i.e. Government of India Act 1935 under the British Act of Parliament. This act also included the Government of Burma Act 1935. According to this act, India would become a federation if 50% of Indian states decided to join it.
